üéÆ How to Use

  1. Navigate to any webpage you want to capture
  2. Click the PrismWeave bookmark in your bookmarks toolbar
  3. Configure your GitHub settings in the popup (first time only)
  4. Click "Capture" to extract and save the content
  5. View your captured markdown files in your GitHub repository

üîí Privacy & Security

  • Local Storage Only: Your GitHub token is stored locally in your browser
  • Direct API Calls: Content is sent directly to GitHub's API
  • No Data Collection: No tracking or analytics are performed
  • Open Source: Full source code is available for review

üéõÔ∏è Configuration Options

  • Repository: Choose which GitHub repository to save to
  • Folder Structure: Organize content by date, domain, or custom folders
  • Content Processing: Enable/disable image downloads, link preservation, and HTML cleaning
  • Commit Messages: Customize automatic commit messages

üÜò Troubleshooting

Bookmarklet Not Working?

Try refreshing the page and clicking again. Some websites have security policies that may interfere.

GitHub API Errors?

Check that your personal access token has repository write permissions.

Content Not Captured?

The page may have unusual HTML structure. Try selecting specific content manually.

Large Content Issues?

Very large pages may be truncated. Consider capturing specific sections instead.
